subsection.name: Installation
subsection.p: Download the binary package from download page and unpack it into a convenient location on the filesystem.
If you want to be able to launch the proxy from any position, you should add the proxy folder to the PATH environment variable.

subsection.name: Setup
subsection.p: The proxy parameters are managed trough a configuration file located in conf/rtspproxy.properties . This is where all the settings can be modified.

This configuration file is a standard Java properties file. For those unfamiliar with this format, this is a INI-like text based format. For a complete description, please refer to Java API documentation
Properties section
.

tr.td: Boolean
This flag let you to enable or disable the debug output of the program..

Specify the full path of the log file
Integer
This is the port at which the proxy will listen for RTSP connection.
String
If you need to define a particular network interface to bind on, specify it here. Default is to listen on all interfaces.
Integer
This is the ports to listen for RTP packets arriving from servers.
Integer

String
Network interface to listen for RTP/RTCP packets from servers. Default is to listen on all interfaces.
Boolean
If true the proxy will try to bind the listener for packet in the first available ports.
Integer
This is the ports to listen for RTP packets arriving from clients.
Integer
This is the ports to listen for RTCP packets arriving from clients.
String
Network interface to listen for RTP/RTCP packets from clients. Default is to listen on all interfaces.
Boolean
If true the proxy will try to bind the listener for packet in the first available ports.
